python package¶

Submodules¶

python.my_dumb_math_tools module¶

My dumb math tools This is a collection of math tools i often use. This is also an example code to test the automatic building of a code documentation.

python.my_dumb_math_tools.add(a, b)¶

Add two numbers and return the result.

python.my_dumb_math_tools.main()¶
python.my_dumb_math_tools.mul(a, b)¶

Multiply two numbers and return the result.

python.my_dumb_math_tools.random_number_generator(arg1, arg2)¶

Summary: Random number generator in the 0-1 range.

This is an example function which generates a random number between 0 and 1 from a given seed computed from to input arguments (arg1, arg2). The seed is computed as (arg1+arg2)*(arg1+arg2)

Parameters

  • arg1 (int) – argument 1 from which computing the seed for the random generator.

  • arg2 (int) – argument 2 from which computing the seed for the random generator.

Returns

Random number between 0 and 1.

Return type

int
